text:
Hi everyone, I have an issue I would like to discuss with you:
A client has a HubSpot portal but does not want to use the HubSpot cookie banner, preferring instead to use the Iubenda cookie banner. So far, this is not a problem because I thought of deactivating the HubSpot cookie banner and using the Iubenda script. However, to be compliant with the European GDPR, I need to block HubSpot cookies and reactivate them as <@U01QVR44MEY> suggested in an old thread with `_hsq.push(['doNotTrack', {track: true}])`.
The issue I'm facing is: are HubSpot cookies legally classified as functional, marketing, or analytical? How can I intelligently activate them by type? And most importantly, is there a list I can refer to? I'm doing this to be 100% compliant.
Is there a smarter solution? Thank you very much.

Good morning everyone! I'm new here and I don't have a developer background so my apologies about it. I was hoping to have your help with an issue related to the cookies and tracking:
In our landing pages we are using One trust for cookies, and we want the HubSpot tracking to be trigger only if the user accepts the cookies in the banner. We implemented the "do not track code" so now it's tracking only when the user accepts cookies (all good) but the problem is that if the user rejects the cookies the tracking is being triggered. Do you have an idea of how it could be solved?
Thanks in advance

We have a Primary Domain set up in HubSpot - event.apexx.global

With the current HS setup we can only have 1 brand domain, and when the above subdomain was set up I thought it's only going to get used for events and webinars.
Now we realised we'd want to host different landing pages.
Can this event.apexx.global subdomain be changed to something else (like resources.apexx.global) and not break a lot of things?

For starters can it even be renamed? Or do I need to create a new one and migrate stuff over there and then get it changed to be the Primary domain?

Has anyone tried to do stuff like this?
Hello, Is it possible to create a Hubdb from a api? so when in the api a item gets removed the item in the hubdb also gets removed so its sort of real time or updated each day?
I do believe that there is a list in the doc page. I’m no legal expect but I believe that most of the cookies are marketing
thank u man

Hi Everyone, I wonder if anyone can address me on this topic:
_If you are not using a HubSpot cookie banner, or are not integrated with GTM or GA4 via <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/integrate-google-analytics-with-HubSpot-content#integrate-google-analytics-using-a-measurement-id|a Measurement ID> or <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/add-the-google-tag-manager-code-to-your-pages#integrate-with-google-tag-manager|GTM ID> you will need to implement Google Consent Mode v2 manually._

We are implementing a third party cookie banner (iubenda) on HubSpot CMS, and I was not able to find further documentation on how to set the cookie banner manually as described in the doc.

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
what do you by "remove the hubdb"?
HubDB has API to CRUD records
hi Estefania we're having a similar issue and looking for a solution here too!

what do you mean by "_but the problem is that if the user rejects the cookies the tracking is being triggered."_ ?

do not track cookie should prevent it, right?

Does HubSpot have a calendar / or something that could be published on a CMS page -- where visitors could see events on a calendar? Or has anyone done something like this with a google calendar integration??
not that I'm aware of - but this would be a classic usecase for a custom repeater module, HubDB or custom objects(enterprise only)
right -- but what calendar do i feed it into <@UJAPS2K4N>
do you have a suggestion

do you want just a listing like
Date | eventname | description | register (optional)
I want a calendar -- that I can push events onto
from HubDB --
:slightly_smiling_face:
I need a calendar view --
like and actual calendar

like this one?
<https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/how-to-design-a-simple-calendar-using-javascript/>
I mean you could modify the script in a way that would show the events of the selected day in a tooltip/modal box
and the data is getting fetched from hubdb

anyone know the secret to this?

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/how-do-I-route-delivery-of-a-form-submission-to-a-specific-user/td-p/980587>
yeah
eactly like that

Hi everyone,

I've just joined this community trying to find out how to setup automated message notifications in my Company Workspace - to designated channels.

Could be when New Contacts are added / Contact moved to Prospect / Deal etc etc.

Would love to be pointed in the right direction if not here then somewhere else would be greatly appreciated. :handshake: :seedling:
